Leek and Puy Lentil Gratin with a Crunchy Feta Topping

by Rukmini Iyer from The Green Roasting Tin

Easy

Serves 4 generously

Total 50min

Prep 10min

Cook 40min

A creamy, cheesy, and deeply comforting dish, Rukmini Iyer's one-tin vegetarian gratin also happens to be packed with nutritious Puy lentils.

From the book

The Green Roasting Tin

Rukmini Iyer

The Green Roasting Tin

Fast one-dish family favourites

All-in-one creative vegan recipes

Easy one-tin vegetarian dinners

Buy Book
amazon
waterstones

Introduction

This filling gratin, with its crisp feta topping, is perfect comfort food â€“ the dining equivalent of sitting cosily on the sofa under a blanket. Itâ€™s good for batch cooking for the week ahead, as any leftovers will keep well for a couple of days in the fridge. This dish is a favourite among friends who helped try out the recipes.

Read more Read less
Tags
VegetarianFetaLeekLentilOne Potone-potDinnerMain CourseEasyQuick

Ingredients

30g butter
3 cloves of garlic, crushed
500g leeks, thinly sliced
2 tsp sea salt
freshly ground black pepper
500g vac-packed cooked Puy lentils
450ml crÃ¨me fraÃ®che
125g feta cheese, crumbled
50g panko or fresh white breadcrumbs
1 tbsp olive oil

Method

Preheat the oven to 180Â°C fan/200Â°C/gas 6. Put the butter and garlic into a roasting tin and pop into the oven to melt while you get on with slicing the leeks.

Mix the sliced leeks with the melted garlic butter, season well with the sea salt and black pepper, then return to the oven to roast for 20 minutes.

After 20 minutes, stir through the Puy lentils, crÃ¨me fraÃ®che and another good scatter of sea salt, then top with the feta cheese and breadcrumbs. Drizzle with the olive oil, then return to the oven for a further 20â€“25 minutes, until golden brown on top.

Serve the gratin hot, with a mustard or balsamic dressed green salad alongside.
